text: what is fuzzing
and what's it for yeah i can give a
quick summary of that so
basically fuzzing is is a form of
automated testing
that can manipulate inputs in a way that
can find bugs that maybe you wouldn't
otherwise be able to find
on your own so in my mind it's kind of a
supplement to
some of the existing testing that people
already do that's pretty common like
unit testing or
integration testing but what sets it
apart is it actually
does things on its own and runs and can
run continuously so
it's kind of smart in a way so if it has
some interesting inputs
it can actually use some intelligence to
go in and mutate those inputs
in interesting and meaningful ways to
find crashes and panics
that wouldn't easily be otherwise found
if the developer had to
try to identify them themselves
